description: Buy the Eureka! Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 6 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 6 Person
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 6 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The tent is a great size for my girlfriend and I to have more relaxed camping trips and have plenty of space to walk even with queen sized air mattress. In the wind it is super loud and the rain cover blows around a ton which is expected, camped with this in the outer banks and the hooks didn’t stay in the and well either.
review.name: Great tent, loud in wind

review.reviewBody: Fantastic tent! Improved from the last model. Easy to put up and take down. Very roomy inside
review.name: New Tent

review.reviewBody: I broke a pole when I setting it up at home to clean the tent out after a camping trip. I contacted Eureka and they sent me a new pole for free no questions asked. The braking of the pole was my own fault and not a result of using the product as intended. However I wish the poles were a little more sturdy.
Perfect for the car camper. I was able to fit 4 cots in it comfortably.
review.name: For the car camper

review.reviewBody:
This tent is massive with a high ceiling. Someone 6'6 can stand in this tent freely. Plenty of space to fit two cots and a ton of gear. I really like this tent for rainy weather since it allows you to stay inside and not have to keep running out to get gear if needed. 

This is NOT a practical tent for overlanding. Setup and teardown for daily travel takes too long. This is a set it and forget it tent. Two able-bodied persons will take 10 to 15 min to setup. As with any tent, the more hands you have to setup the faster it will go.
review.name: Perfect for couples that need space.

review.reviewBody: Upgraded from a 4 person tent to this 6 person Eureka Copper Canyon tent after having a baby because we wanted to take her camping with us. This tent is very roomy. We were unfortunate to have very heavy rain, but we were kept completely dry. My husband is 6'6 tall and he is able to stand up in it. This tent is easy to set up and take down. I highly recommend purchasing the foot print that fits it as well.

I purchased a 12x12  Copper Canyon 8 years ago and camp in it an average of 2 times a month plus camping at IMSA race venues. This tent has always remained dry during some serious rain storms and has remained structurally sound. I still own a 4 person Timberline tent that I purchased in 1988 and it still provides great sheltering and retains it's waterproof qualities.  Excellent products!
review.name: Great endurance!!

review.reviewBody: I love the Copper Canyon LX 6. My opinion: the size, ease of setup, features, quality of materials and construction make this a great value. The combination of sleeved poles for the roof and clipped poles for the corners of the walls works well. I am fan of and prefer clips, but in this application the sleeves for the roof makes one person setup without a step stool possible. The light gray fabric for the upper portions of the walls provides both a pleasing and plentiful ambient light in the daytime, which I like. I like the clip secured windows. They have good overlap with the solid fabric walls and a bottom edge that is sewn to channel and drain rainwater. There are many interior rings for hang items, and includes four at corners of the floor for securing a liner/mat/carpet.  I found that the rainfly to pole velcro tabs is a huge help for getting it placed over the top of the tent. Rather than trying to throw it over the top, which I have hard time doing, I focus on getting one corner vecrod in place and then work my way around the tent securing subsequent corners the same way.  The fly slides nicely over the top making installation quick and absent the struggle that typically comes with battling gusts of wind.
review.name: Copper Canyon LX 6 is great!

review.reviewBody: After 48 hours of straight downpour the tent was bone dry. What a testament of function and quality. Its definitely a late spring, summer, early fall temperature construction. We use two large cots and there’s so much additional room. Gear lofts are fine in the ceiling but additional lofts can be purchased and strung on the sides if wanted (which is what we did). The door definitely requires a two-handed operation it’s so tightly configured. You must relieve the stress on the zipper. Beware, a one handed brute force approach is going to damage the zipper.  Takes some patience but then again tent people have more of that virtue than the glamping crowd to begin with! The ventilation that is capable with this tent is extraordinary. No more blazing hot tent in the summer. The integrated guy tie-outs at the corners of the fly is simply brilliant and extremely strong. Have not had the luxury of a genuine wind storm to test this but i’ll conjecture this tent will be unaffected by gale forces. The ‘bottom’ roof pole MUST be inserted first; then the top roof pole and install its legs first. That’s all the procedure requires to eliminate problems. What a great tent for a small family but beware the cautionary note with the zipper. Small children are not patient with most everything.
review.name: LX6 Copper Canyon Dream

review.reviewBody: So after having an Eddie Baur tent for 20 years we needed a new one. My husband came across this tent. And let me tell you it didn't disappoint. So easy to set up. The windows are huge! Watched a meteor show while laying in bed!! Loved how my husband who is 6.3 could stand up and still have room to move around. We are planning on buying the 4 person one for our daughter.
review.name: Amazing tent

name: Copper Canyon LX Tent: 3-Season 6 Person

review.reviewBody:
These fit differently in a pleasant way compared to what I’ve experienced before, the padding at the heel was a change I was a little hesitant to at first but can honestly say they overdelivered. The lug sole is not only ideal for trails but also sidewalks. I am almost hyperaware of how often I use my trail shoes in the city to avoid the tread wearing out, but these are the perfect in between. I have taken them on at least 8 work out classes over the past few weeks and a few 5+ mile trail runs and love them! If I have nothing nice to say about a product, I say nothing at all but when I genuinely like a product, I make sure to shout it from the rooftops. I was today years old when I realized what makes these so comfortable is the anatomical last. I wear 7.5 in Salomon quest, 7.5 in Cloudultra, and 7.5 in Merrell Antora. The 7.5 in this style fit like a glove. 

#Backcountry Gearhead.
review.name: Bomb Diggity

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing the Here Lows for a few weeks and love them so far! They are the perfect summer hiking shoe, as they are lightweight, breathable/ventilated, quick draining (for any stream crossings), very comfortable, and highly energetic/responsive. They also have fantastic multi-directional traction on slippery rock, yet the lugs are deep enough to dig into dirt, sand and loose rocks. I found the fit to be true to size, but have heard others mention to consider a half size up, so I'd say if you're on the low end of your size, go with your regular size, but if you're closer to the top of the range, size up 1/2 size. There is a heel cushion inside the shoe that sits on the Achilles, so that can add a little more volume but makes the shoe feel more plush and helps your heel locked in place so it doesn't slide around inside the shoe.
review.name: Awesome Summer Hikers

review.reviewBody: This trail shoe is lightweight and well-ventilated, making it an awesome summer hiking shoe. The lugs on the bottom of the shoe are tall and fairly aggressive, so they perform well on different types of substrates. We have a variety of trail substrates in Utah, from desert (loose sand/rock) to watershed (wet/loose soil), so it's important to have a versatile shoe that can be used for diverse adventures. The Vasque Here Low does not disappoint!
review.name: Versatile summer hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: My next plan is to use the Thule strap to subdue criminals. It does everything else
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody:
Bought a set of these straps in 1988 and still use them today to keep longboards in the truck bed.  I have had other straps that worked in a similar manner that have fallen apart or had the tightening mechanism fail.  

I am buying another set for securing loads above the cab.  

Good job Thule!
review.name: Excellent Product   Super Durability

review.reviewBody: I love my new roof rack!
review.name: Excellent fitment for my 1990 VW Vanagon!

review.reviewBody: These are great for strapping anything that needs to be strapped down on your roof roack (thule rack or otherwise). I discovered them when I bought my first Thule kayak mount and I've purchased maybe 8 pair since then, some for use with my car rack (so I don't have to use the ones that came with my kayak) as well as giving as gifts.
review.name: Everyone should have a pair

name: Load Straps - 2 Pack

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and stylish love them never bought shoes from north face before but impressed
review.name: Comfy shoes for my painful bunion

review.reviewBody: It was very good. I use it daily for few miles walk
review.name: I would recommend this product to everyone for trail walking

review.reviewBody: I've gone through 3 pairs of the Altamesa 300s. They are my absolute favorite pair of trail running shoes. When I saw the 500s come out, I was hoping they would be nearly the same just with a little extra cushion. While I did really like them, they felt a little stiffer and less springy than the 300s to me. All in all a great shoe though. I will always choose NorthFace when it comes to trail runners. I've tried all the brands and keep coming back.
review.name: I would definitely buy again if they discontinue 300s

review.reviewBody: I never thought that I'd buy shoes this price, but after wearing them, while wandering unsteady trails outside; these are definitely built to last and built for the outdoors. I highly recommend these.
review.name: Built to Last

review.reviewBody: very nice pairs. bought it to my wife, she liked it, looking buy again
review.name: I would by this product again

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for my wife, and they turned out to be an excellent pair! very stylish
review.name: I would by this product again

review.reviewBody: I use these shoes for work, im walking all night and sometimes stand in one place for a couple minutes. But I love these shoes they are comfortable. The cushion definitely comes in handy so your feet don't hurt. I would recommend and I love them
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: Cushy shoe but the super thick and wide sole made the shoe unstable for me. I felt like I might fall of rocky trails
review.name: Jump sole seemed unstable

review.reviewBody: My second pair of these shoes- great cushion, true to size, good support. Two reasons I gave 4 stars- I wish they offered a bit of a more aggressive lug pattern as a "trail shoe" and I do not understand why all the light color choices. They look dirty, worn, and used after only a few runs.
review.name: Good shoe to offer support/cushion in the trail shoe line

review.reviewBody: I really LOVED these shoes. I 100% recommend them to you. I went camping for a whole week in Colorado, I did too many hikes, and never took these shoes off. I was afraid they were going to hurt me, so I took an extra pair. I never got to use the other ones. These shoes are light, and the traction is amazing. I always have to use shoe insoles, but with these shoes I didn't have to.
review.name: 100% recommended!!

review.reviewBody: They feel like Figs Scrubs and could totally pass as scrubs. Super comfy! I've gained lots of weight so I sized up to a large and they are very big on me.
review.name: Scrub Girlies This is Your Jogger

review.reviewBody: Light weight, true to size and fit perfectly length wise. Not too baggy either but enough where they don’t fit like leggings.
review.name: Light, true to size joggers

review.reviewBody: Great for lounging around the house or running errands! Especially for the price. They feel really premium.
review.name: Comfy jogger

review.reviewBody: These pants have just the right amount of bagginess for a jogger, which is to say, not very baggy! They flatter the derriere, are the perfect length, feel soft and comfortable.
review.name: Flattering cut

review.reviewBody: I purchased these on a whim and so happy I did. I traveled in these joggers are they’re super comfortable. High waisted which is a favorite of mine, but not tight around my waist. Warm, but breathable and super flattering. Would hands down buy these in all the colors.
review.name: Best joggers

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable joggers I've ever worn! They're the perfect travel pant too- big pockets and super cozy yet lightweight.
review.name: Smooth as butter

review.reviewBody: These are everything I wanted them to be, cozy, soft and warm! I can layer with these, wear them to the gym, do yoga, all the activities!
review.name: Super cozy!

review.reviewBody:
I bought these in black to have as a plain everyday jogger, and love them!! The fabric is so nice, really soft, doesn't stretch out, and doesn't collect dog hair (which is a plus). For reference, I'm 5'9" 175lb and the L would have worked and was long enough, but the waist was too loose, and there was too much fabric in the groin area. I sized down to a M and they fit great! I would like them to be a little longer, but that's okay. They're still a great pant. I bought the oyster color, but it's a little too off-white for my taste, so I'll be exchanging for another black pair.
I've worn several times for lounging and running errands, washed a couple times/hang dried, and they're doing well so far. Not sure how the fabric would hold up with regular machine drying, would hate for them to slowly thin out, so hang drying is probably best.
review.name: LOVE- Buying more!

review.reviewBody: I loved the fabric, color and cut of these joggers but my torso must be too short for this style, because these joggers are baggy on the hips and the crotch point is too low.
review.name: Runs large for my shape

name: Venture Jogger - Women's

description: Buy the Shimano XT WH-M8120 29in Boost Wheel online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: XT WH-M8120 29in Boost Wheel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XT WH-M8120 29in Boost Wheel online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I love Shimano components and have had a long history of using Shimano hubs for 30+ wheelsets across every type of bike.

This might be the last MTB hub/wheelset that I use from them. 

After this winter I pulled my bike down expecting minimal maintenance barring some lubing and bearing checks. In the stand the freehub worked great. At the end of the first ride I started to get me pedal feedback and chain slack. At home the freehub was definitely the source of the issue.

Taking the wheel apart is not easy; Shimano have made a simple system very complex. I never fully diagnosed the issue, and my local shop was unable to figure anything out but the springs and internal ratchets in the freehub body seem to be the issue. It's documented by others that it can be a problem but seems to be on a hub-by-hub basis.

Can't recommend the wheel.
review.name: Beware of Durability

review.reviewBody: They are pretty sweet wheels.  Build quality is exceptional.  They feel very solid, stiff, and lighter than they actually are.  The hub engagement is great too.  Maxxis 2.5 tires sealed up very well with just a floor pump.  Big fan!  Great wheels for the price.
review.name: Great Wheelset

name: XT WH-M8120 29in Boost Wheel

hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl Alcanadre Guide Bag online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I almost feel like I am betraying my trusted Imlay packs but Petzl hit this one out of the park.  It has great rugged materials for the harshest canyons.  The overall layout is great for canyoneering flow.  I really like the pocket at the bottom under the room.  Caution, this can get dusty.  It is very comfortable.  I have no issues carrying my 200' rope plus plenty of gear.

review.reviewBody: Purchased a large, was send a medium. Was sent out another large for replacement and received an extra large. I gave up and returned both, but on the positive side, they refunded my shipping and were very nice!
review.name: Sent the wrong hat twice

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this hat. Fit well, felt good. Brim and crown were in good shape from shipping. However, the hat band was delaminated from the crown in several spots, making the hat not worth keeping. I would’ve like to make an in-kind return, but I have little confidence I’d be getting anything back other than the same hat.
review.name: Little Detail

review.reviewBody: I really like the hat but it came beat up. Creases in the crown and brim. Not sure if I can get them out or not. The hat material is very thin.  The large is a bit to large but I?m afraid the medium would have been to small.   I?m happy with the hat but really disappointed more care was not taken with the packing. It came folded up and crammed into the box. Not how one treats a hat. We shall see if I can fix it or not.
review.name: Love the hat but

review.reviewBody: Had a pair of these on my bike hooked up to an indoor trainer.  Not exactly harsh conditions.  But one of  the cages them broke just by pulling a bottle out of it.   Aside from not lasting very long, they do everything one would expect of a water bottle cage.
review.name: Not Durable

review.reviewBody:
I know that colors are hard to match from online photos, but the "Sky Blue" version of this would be better called "Gray Blue" in my eyes.

otherwise, the cage itself is quite rigid compared with other non-metallic cages I have owned.
review.name: Color not true to online photo

review.reviewBody: Not sure if others have had lemons or what... but I've had some of these on my bike for 3 years now with zero issues. And trust me, i am not gentle on them.
review.name: works as designed, extremely durable

review.reviewBody: Works perfectly fine but it seems like some may be defective based on other reviews. I’ve used mine quite a bit and have had Zero issues with it
review.name: Works and hasn’t broken

review.reviewBody: A top sidearm broke within the first two rides.  The plastic seems more brittle than other cages, and I shouldn't have ignored all the reviews out there about them breaking.
review.name: Don't buy it!

review.reviewBody:
Bought it despite the reviews here and elsewhere about breaking.  Well, sure enough.  Two rides and one of the "arms" cracked.
Worthless.  
Save your money and the headache.
review.name: Avoid!!!

review.reviewBody: After about 200 miles, mine cracked where it cradles the base of the bottle. Never threw a bottle so the cage works well, but it cracks way too easily.
review.name: Holds Well, Breaks Easy

review.reviewBody: The Ribcage II does exactly what it is supposed to do, hold your water bottle tightly so it won?t pop out when you hit a bump. Designed for left or right side access. Can be awkward to get a bottle in or out sometimes though. I am a big fan of its sleek aero look. Been using for several months now. Liking 'em.
review.name: Sleek and Aero

review.reviewBody: I'm returning to buy my 8th rib cage II.  It's the only secure and reliable cage I've used and surprised to see all the reviews.  Use on my and my wife's gravel bikes (x2 each), my hardtail xc race (x2), my full susp x1, and her old full suspension bike x1.  We've only broken 1, and it was due to a crash and underside downtube mount.  I've only lost 1 water bottle in 100's if not 1000's of hours of mountain biking... Very surprised at that.  Feel bad for those that broke a cage in the first few weeks, but I guess anything is possible.  We've been very happy, and here I am, ordering another one for the next new bike build happening now.
review.name: Surprised at the bad reviews

review.reviewBody:
Do not buy.
As others have said it cracks easily. Bought 4 for my Roubaix. 2 in the normal spots and two on the seat using the swat mount.

The two on the mount broke in the same day. Apparently you can't just ride with filled bottles. 
$75 down the drain (2 cages and swat mount)
review.name: Absolute trash

name: Rib Cage II

review.reviewBody: This is definitely one of my favorite riding shirts. I’m typically a size medium in most things, but sized down to a small for this. The medium felt a little more oversized than I wanted, but the small fit perfect. Liked it so much I ended up purchasing in 2 colors.
review.name: Favorite riding shirt

review.reviewBody: this shirt performs great on the mountain, it's breathable and stretchy. Slightly on the heavier side for athletic material; I wear it when it's under 80F out. I'm 5'9, about 190lbs athletic, and size L fits relaxed. I do wish the stitching around the neck was stretchier, feels like that fits a little tight and isn't so comfy for sliding over my head.
review.name: Solid MTB Tee

review.reviewBody: Thought I would give this shirt a try as I am switching more from my old bike jerseys to shirts for mountain biking. I am a 36D, 30 waist and went with the medium which fits true to the size chart. Will be a nice shirt for biking this summer. Will likely get another in a different color.
review.name: Would Recommend

review.reviewBody: I don't have a ton to say about this jersey, but that's a good thing! OR put out a great fitting, ultra wicking ride tee that also feels insanely soft against the skin. I'm not usually someone that gravitates towards short sleeve jerseys but I love riding in this one!
review.name: Simple in all the right ways

name: Freewheel Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's

description: Buy the NiteRider Lumina Max 1500 NiteLink Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lumina Max 1500 NiteLink Headlight
hasVariant.description: Buy the NiteRider Lumina Max 1500 NiteLink Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Light is bright, USB-C is appreciated, price is right. BUT, there are a couple issues with this light that turned me off (pun intended). First, the beam pattern isnt the best for and MTB handlebar light, its a bit too focused. But the critical issue is that the large physical size of the light combined with the compliance of the plastic mount results in distracting bouncing of the beam on mountain bike descents. It might be a decent light for smoother asphalt rides or maybe as a helmet-mounted light (perhaps a bit large and heavy for helmet but thats a personal preference). But I would not recommend it as a handlebar-mounted mountain bike light.
review.name: Probably not the best for rough MTB

name: Lumina Max 1500 NiteLink Headlight

review.reviewBody: Description says packable (which is why I got it) but it won't pack into its pocket (and the pocket's zipper isn't reversible for that purpose). Hood is way too small; doesn't form a "bill" over your forehead, so rain gets into your eyes, especially if you have a pony tail in your hair. Hood seems adjustable, but can only make it smaller; no way to make it bigger (need it more "floppy" so it can cover my eyes when I'm out walking or hiking in rain and cannot use an umbrella). Seems waterproof, although no typical “beading up” of rain. Good weight for casual wear, but not technical (won't bring this on a 5-day hiking trip due to lack of packability and lack of a functional hood).
review.name: Will NOT pack into own pocket; Hood is too small
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our Women's PreCip® Eco Pro Jacket product. We truly appreciate you bringing the design matter to our attention.

The Women's PreCip® Eco Pro Jacket unfortunately does not fold into its own pocket, however, it is packable, meaning that it is lightweight and portable. If you would be interested in a product which stuffs into its own pocket, we would recommend either the Precip Eco Jacket or the Pinnacle DriClime Hoody.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not fully met your expectations.
 
We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fantastic jacket. I upgraded to this after wearing the original PreCip Eco (vs Pro) in Patagonia for 3 weeks a couple of years ago and staying dry. The Pro is awesome and I’m excited to test it out on the O trek in a few weeks — feels sturdier than the non Pro and is very breathable
review.name: Upgrade!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat has a great cut; it is comfortable and does not make noise. Stayed dry and cozy in the rain and wind and looked great. After a lot of research, we purchased both the men's and women's version of this coat for the main function of keeping us dry, the pit zips for ventilation while hiking, and the adjustable hood for city walking in the rain (mostly this!). So far it is a top performer in all the categories we were searching for!
review.name: Comfort, function, value

review.reviewBody: This is my second jacket. The first jacket the  lining started to shed after 5 years. I like the fit, I use’s it for workout and running errands. There are some improvements in this one. Hopefully it last longer.
review.name: My favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for hiking, and I like all the features, especially the underarm zips, but it is not waterproof, which is a big disappointment. I can’t take the dog for a 20 minute walk without getting wet underneath.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment:
Hello there.

We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing  issues with our product. Please kindly file warranty claim through our website here:

https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via Contact Us | Marmot or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank You.
Marmot Team.

review.reviewBody: I am really disappointed in this jacket.  This is only the second time I've worn it and I'm regretting buying it.  I was walking outside for 20 minutes and the lower arms  and shoulders are soaked through.
review.name: Got soaked after 20 minutes outside
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
 
We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. In order to get repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:
 
https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I actually ended up returning this jacket. It was too boxy and not flattering.
review.name: Returned
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I ordered this jacket to replace my old Marmot jacket that had finally worn out after more than 10 years.  Although the old version was awesome, this new version is even better and more improved!  I love the better lining and better pockets.  I'm sure this new jacket will serve me fabulously for many years to come.
review.name: Best Rain Jacket Ever

name: PreCip Eco Pro Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi P.R.O. Gel Vent Glove  - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: P.R.O. Gel Vent Glove  - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi P.R.O. Gel Vent Glove  - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Yeah...they do run small.  I ordered the size as indicated by the chart and also matched the sizing for my previous pairs of Pearl Izumi gloves.  But they are definitely a tight fit.  Getting the gloves on is a bit of a wrestling match (dry, room temperature hands).  If it wasn't for the pull tabs on the middle and ring fingers, you'd probably have to cut them off (a sweaty hand, etc.).  That said, while riding they are comfortable and do the job well--padding is good; not too much, not too little.  The world still awaits the perfect invention, design and manufacture of the ultimate cycling glove.  In the meantime, these will have to do.
review.name: Runs small, kinda works...

review.reviewBody: Well constructed gloves. A bit tighter and thicker than PI's previous iterations of this model. They do the job
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody:
These gloves run a size smaller than other gloves I have purchased from PI.  Once you get them on they feel nice and comfortable.  Taking them off takes time.  After a day of riding the back of the gloves have sweat marks and look dirty like you have been wearing them for days on end without laundering them.  
I wouldn’t buy these again just for those two reasons but that’s my opinion.
review.name: Ok glove but not great

review.reviewBody: I've had the gloves about a month and so far I've been impressed. The quality and fit are exceptional so far. I've used them on several all day rides. They are very comfortable and stand up to hand washing very well. I highly recommend these gloves.
review.name: Excellent Gloves!

name: P.R.O. Gel Vent Glove  - Men's

review.reviewBody: I prefer pants over shorts for riding in almost any weather due to the insane amount of sagebrush in Utah, but it's rare that pants don't feel stifling in the summer heat. Enter the MT500 Burner Lites! These things fit super well and breathe even better, plus they're perfect for people with long inseams like me (31.5in). My only gripe is that the waist closure isn't the most secure since the zipper doesn't lock at the top, but this seems to be more of an issue off the bike than on the bike.
review.name: Lightweight, durable, and almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
I've finally found a pair of women's MTB pants that I actually like and don't feel like high-waters with my long legs. 

I bought a Medium, I usually wear a size 28 pant and have 30-31 inseam (they are a little loose on me, but I don't like super-tight pants while riding, plus when I have a chamois on underneath they fit like a dream) 

First impressions, they are super light-weight and insanely comfortable. There is a small zipper coming up the front with 2 snap buttons.

They have low-profile & adjustable velcro straps along both of the front sides of the waistband. 

There is one zipper pocket on the back of the pants that I didn't really use, I did use the two zipper pockets on the front of the pant to hold my phone, chap stick, small things like that. 

The pants are durable enough that when my dog jumps up on me, she doesn't scratch them or leave any marks. 

I will be buying these in the black color too!
review.name: Comfy Light Pants (Great for being Tall)

name: MT500 Burner Lite Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great waders thus far. Only have a couple fishing trips with them so far but they are comfortable and dry! Suspenders are very comfortable.
review.name: Great product so far!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have tried them yet but they fit very well and are comfortable
review.name: Jr

review.reviewBody:
I am new to fly fishing and got these waders to build out my kit.  I haven't tried other waders but these things are a thing of beauty.  I have used GTX for snow-sports so I trust the material choices.

After several trips with walking multiple miles in the river, along slick & rocky banks, and through thorny bushes and have had no issue on comfort or durability.  They stay dry through multiple hours submerged.  I am not sweating from the approach or exit hikes.  I feel like I'm wearing regular pants I sometimes have to double-check I'm suited up before I walk into the water.  They dry out quickly in my garage but I do adjust the gravel guards after a few hours to help the booties dry off quicker.

Others have asked about the harness straps and I've never had any concerns where they claim to become uncomfortable after extended use.  The wide harness straps are super comfortable and the adjustments make it fit well with any level of layering I use.

I also think they look great compared to some other designs.
I sized down so that it wasn't too baggy... this is the only concern I had was excess bulkiness, not an issue so far even if the layering makes this a little more snug.
review.name: First Waders - New Angler - Happy Fishing

review.reviewBody: Hardcore new jersey surf fisherman here and I'm always in the water at least 2-3 times a week. Bought these beginning of 2023 and it's been holding up pretty dang good so far. No complaints.
review.name: Simply the best!

review.reviewBody:
My waders leaked from the feet after the second use.  The build-quality other than that is good.  I think there is a problem with quality control for the neoprene feet.  I filed a warranty claim and have been waiting 8 days for a response.

One star is all these waders merit.

Thank you for your consideration.  Please refund or replace my waders immediately.
review.name: Leaky Feet After Two Uses

review.reviewBody: Good fit. I appreciate many want and like a review within days of purchase, but the value of any wader review is how they function after a season. So recognizing this limitation, lets state, I am satisfied with the buy and will fish in them for the upcoming season in New Zealand.
review.name: Goto fit, especially in the foot.

review.reviewBody: Bought this because my last pair sprung a leak in the neoprene sock. These have a new design with no seam sitting at the heel so was a great update, seem burly and held up to sticks and down’d trees when bushwhacking along the river. Only downside is they don’t have a flip out waterproof pouch inside the chest like many other brands, does have a pocket there though.
review.name: Burley Wadder

review.reviewBody: I was stunned the first time I wore these!!!  The suspension is like no other. I can barely tell I'm wearing them. The waders come up higher on the chest than other waders which does make getting them off a bit more difficult for taking a leak. Next time I'll invest in the zippered option. Overall impression so far is fantastic!!!
review.name: My new favorite waders!!!

review.reviewBody: I am a full time guide and these waders were given to me from the shop I guide out of to help advertise and sell these.   I wouldn’t take them for anything more than free. The zipper on the pocket broke within 5 days of using, they leaked the next day after the zipper broke. I’ve fixed the leak and a new one shows up almost immediately. These are nowhere near 4 layer goretex. Maybe 2 layer. I can’t keep these waders from leaking. They are so fragile and by far the worst pair of waders I have ever owned. I’m very disappointed. I wanted these to be great but they just weren’t. I’m hoping they fix their issues and make a great wader in the future. But for now stay away from them
review.name: Guide tested and failed
comment:
Hi there,

Thank you for your feedback regarding our Boundary GORE-TEX Stocking Footwaders.

We are reaching out to you directly via your email address provided to help resolve this issue for you.

review.reviewBody: Fabulous Waders. Very comfortable.  I am impressed with how warm my feet have been during winter fishing in Northern Utah. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great Product

name: Boundary Stockingfoot Wader - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus Closure Cap SoftBottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have been using a variety of “soft” water bottles for several years. It all started with me wanting to minimize the volume in my day pack, so the self-reducing size of this bottle was a no brainer. I do treat them a bit more gently than my solid blocky water bottles, but they last for many years and I’ve never had a sudden catastrophic seam failure that soaked my pack.

I prefer 2 or 3 half-liter bottles, that way I can make one electrolyte water and the other(s) plain water. I prefer the push-pull tops even though (as has been previously mentioned) they can be hard to open/close. But I consider that to be a feature not a bug b/c it insures the cap is less likely to open on its own inside my pack. 

Do bigger bottles have their place? Of course, especially for screwing on a water filter, but I’m always going to have a least three of these softies in my rotation. Recommended!
review.name: A Unique and Functional Water Bottle Option

review.reviewBody: J’aurais aimé avoir un endroit sur la bouteille pour y mettre un mousqueton..
review.name: J’aurais aimé avoir un endroit

review.reviewBody: Hello, can I have ask? It is possible to fill the bottle (SoftBottle 1L) with hot water?
review.name: Hot watter

review.reviewBody: Perfect for small trips and very lightweight and packable.
review.name: Perfect for small trips and

review.reviewBody: j'ai deux gourdes Platypus équipées de bouchons push and pull tellement durs qu'inutilisables sauf avec des pinces!!!
review.name: Push and pull : Dangereux pour les dents!!!

review.reviewBody: I've been using these collapsible water bottles for years only replacing them when I've lost them. They last forever, fit in anything, weigh almost nothing when empty, and I've never had any problems with them, UNTIL... I couldn't get the closure cap bottles locally any more. I bought 3 bottles with push/pull type caps and every one of them leaks terribly. The threading is already warped from trying to close it fully enough to stop it from leaking. It gets all over the inside of my bag and leaked hand filtered water I filled it with during a backpacking trip into my pack and then again all over my tent when I knocked it over accidentally during the night. Do not buy the push/pull caps. It says it all in the name. Buy the "Closure" cap.
review.name: New push/pull caps all leak

review.reviewBody: Great waterbottles for hiking. Good for freezing 3/4 of the way to keep lunch cold, extra ice water or an emergency compress.
review.name: Great waterbottles for hiking. Good

review.reviewBody: Keep them in the freezer for storage, when not in use. You can boil them as well. Great for the outdoors. Watch out for eukaryotic organisms, though. Cheers.
review.name: Jazz

review.reviewBody: I have been using Platypus water bottles for about 25 yrs. They are so handy - weigh almost nothing, fit in a purse and go flat when empty. Always carry a 1 liter (which I usually use as a hot water bottle plus 2 of the .5 liter bottles for drinking. I need to replace the .5 liter size, but I can't find them in the catalog now. Is that size not made anymore? I really like that size and use it the most, so I hope that it is still available!
review.name: soft-water bottle

review.reviewBody: I have one of these that’s 15 years old and it has never let me down other than the color starting to get a bit yellow. That said, I bought a new one for my ski pack. I prefer the closure cap, I just feel it’s more secure. Wasn’t sure how I’d feel about the narrow waist, but it actually allows you to hold and drink from the bottle like you would any other bottle. Good bombproof soft bottle that packs down to nothing and should last a long time.
review.name: I have one of these

name: Closure Cap SoftBottle

Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: This was just what I was looking for.  Works in warm or cold conditions.
review.name: Versatile Double Sleeping bag.

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable, it kept us warm. It would be nice to be able to unzip on both sides but otherwise great
review.name: Very nice sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Took this sleeping bag on a camping trip in the Okefenokee Swamp in late December 2023. The nights were around 40 degrees so fairly chilly and this sleeping bag kept me and my sister very warm and comfortable through the night! Perfect for cooler weather. I can't wait to try it out in warmer weather too!
review.name: Absolutely perfect for our winter camping trip!

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love. Love. Love. We have used it for the desert in CA, rainy day in Oregon. We camp in a tent.⛺️ oh an a boat deck in WA. It's not too bulky and it keeps us warm. I love the flexibility of having a sleeping bag with different temperatures layers. I will say that depending on where you put your sleeping bag... like if it's really cold and you have an air mattress you can heel a little of the cold air on the bottom. But if you have a padded or another warm layer it's fine.
review.name: Versatile and effective

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Put this in my rooftop tent and spent 60+ straight days on a road trip with another person. We where in weather from 45 degrees at night in California all the way to -27 degrees up in Canada and i was thoroughly impressed with the warmth and versatility of this bag we did use a mr buddy heater at times during the trip but overall the bag performed great throughout the night and we where able to sleep in all variations of weather without any complaints (both of us over 6' tall). Since that trip I have also been using each individual piece as down blankets for random camping and hanging around and they work awesome for that as well. Over all great bang for your buck if your looking for solid edition to your car camping set up.
review.name: Great Rooftop Tent Bag

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality product. Great for car camping with kids. Very warm and easy to put into stuff sack. The option to customize warmth is also a great feature.
review.name: Great for couples or camping with kids

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Great versatile bag setup, but the stitching on the one I have has been coming undone in different spots. Perhaps a defect but the construction might just be mediocre on these bags...
review.name: Stitching on couple spots after few uses

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to launder, easy to separate and re-zip the pieces, very comfortable, perfect large sleeping bag with plenty of leg room. I love that you can fold over the top layer to just one side if two sleepers want different weights/temperatures. Certainly not for backpacking, but not overly bulky or heavy at all for what it is. Exactly what I wanted.
review.name: Perfect warm but lighter weight roomy sleeper for two.

review.itemreviewed: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We are not campers...YET! This sleeping bag may change that! We bought this to sleep in the back of the Jeep so we could go on Mtn Bike trips but we haven't had a chance to use it that way yet. So far, we've used it in a trailer at 30 degrees and in a cooler home at 55 degrees. This bag kept us at just the right temp! It's 3 bags in one so we could use the whole thing for the colder temps and take a layer off for warmer. So easy and comfortable, even my husband loves it!
review.name: I would buy this bag over and over!

name: Dolomite One Double Sleeping Bag: 15F Synthetic

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Unicorn Swan Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Perfect for toddler who likes to play in the mud! Like that he can pull them on by himself.
review.name: Perfect toddler style

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Unicorn Swan Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Pretty sturdy and cute! Sides are a bit floppy which was a little funky for my 2 year old but they do the job.
review.name: Pretty cute

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Unicorn Swan Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: These are the best spring boots for toddlers! My granddaughter loves them!
review.name: Toddlers love them!

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Unicorn Swan Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: We just received these boots yesterday. As soon as my daughter put them on she slipped twice which is completely odd for rain boots. They came with some kind of oil on the bottoms, I guess to prevent them from cracking but I think customers should be warned. I wanted to return but she really wanted them, once we walked on the side walk the grip was great. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FOR BABIES OR TODDLERS LEARNING TO WALK. Stick to the previous model, we owned that pair and never had that issue.
review.name: Boots should come with a warning

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Unicorn Swan Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'

review.name: Perfect!!

review.itemreviewed: Skipper II Unicorn Swan Rain Boot - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots for my little grandson and he seems to like them. Great fit and true to size.
review.name: Great for kids

review.reviewBody: This is a remake of old 5.10 V10's, which I never used.  I've used these for about a month and really like them.  I wear a street shoe size 10 USM and bought the Vim in 10 USM.  Feels like the perfect size.  A little tough to get on, but comfy once on.  Broke in within a couple short sessions.  I have a narrow foot, Miuras and pythons fit my foot perfectly, and the Vims fit my foot well.  They are definitely a little less pointy than miuras or pythons.  They feel pretty middle of the road for stiffness.  I've only used them for bouldering, but I think they'll be a pretty good sport shoe.  Size labels fell out within 1 session, but I'm hoping the rest of the shoe doesn't fall apart as quick.
review.name: solid shoe

name: Vim Shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydro Flask 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: I love this bottle! I am field sales and spend my day in the car driving long distances. After learning how much water I should be consuming I bought one of these for the volume. It fits one of my cup holders in the car which turns out is pretty important for what I need. I add electrolytes, magnesium and creatine and no issues with interior degradation. Its lightweight for the size so easier to carry to the car and maneuver when driving. I added the twist top (which I also love because it fully disassembles for cleaning) which is important because the water runs fast towards you and I was dousing myself on a regular. I'm seriously considering a second one to replace another Hydroflask that doesn't fit the cup holder and is more of a hassle to manage when driving. There is no boot option but thats ok for me and if you were to stuff it in a sack for hiking you'd regret having a sticky boot.
review.name: Favorite One

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Never dropped…. Within the first couple months insulation failed. Had to return on my dime which was about a third of the cost.
review.name: Won’t buy again.

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The "Lightweight" feature is awesome when every oz. counts, on long hikes or backpacking.
review.name: Trail Series

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: It’s a big fail that Hydroflask couldn’t produce a straw that is suitable for this taller container. They put marketing spin this fail saying that when you can’t get anything more, it’s just a sign to refill. That’s absurd. Make a longer straw. Offer it free to owners of this product.
review.name: Straw is too short

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Color is beautiful, gives slytherin vibes. Slight gloss/shimmer. Hence the color name.. hahaha!!
Got it for my husband for everyday use/school. Definitely lightweight. Still a bit heavy of course when you add ice and water but feels light. Definitely slim enough to get in the side water pocket of a north face backpack. (not sure about other backpacks)
Other Wide mouth tops fit, but not their booties for the bottle ones; so if your wanting a bootie for this; like mentioned in the description get the trail series bootie. The regular won’t fit this one.
review.name: Beautiful.

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the size and color, but the water DOES NOT stay cold like the original. I have probably a minimum of 20 different Flasks and containers...this truly disappointed!
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was initially excited about this water bottle due to its sleek design and promises of durability, but my experience has been extremely disappointing. After just three months of use, the base of the bottle developed unsightly brown spots, which seem to be corrosion. I only used it for water, so there’s no reason it should have deteriorated this quickly and I’m concerned about the safety of drinking from it.
For a bottle advertised as durable, this is a huge letdown. It’s not worth the money if it starts degrading this quickly. I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone looking for a long-lasting water bottle.
review.name: Poor Quality – Corroded with Brown Spots in Just 3 Months

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: These bottles are not the same quality as the regular flasks. My bottle got cold so i warrantied it. I got my new one about a month ago and its doing the same thing. The insulation is broken. I also bought there regular bottle a while ago and it has zero issues. Stay away from the trail series.
review.name: Insulation doesnt work.

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Works great for work and fits great inside my work bag
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great upgrade from my last trail series one. Larger capacity and easier to hold
review.name: Perfect for the trail or the flight

name: 40oz Wide Mouth Trail LW Flex Cap Water Bottle

review.reviewBody: The fabric feels a bit stiff at first—maybe a few washes and some wear will soften it up, but it's not super comfortable straight out of the box. I have a lot of Assos gear, and, honestly, these knee warmers don’t quite hit the usual quality mark I expect from the brand. The upper edges tend to fold under when putting them on, which can be a hassle to adjust. They’re definitely warm, so they’re well-suited for cold weather, but might be a bit much for milder Southern California temperatures. The fit is nice and snug, almost like compression leggings, which I do appreciate. Overall, I’m on the fence with these; they don’t quite live up to the style and comfort of my previous Assos knee warmers, which I’ve used to the end of their lifespan. I expected to be as impressed as I am with my other Assos products—bib shorts, jerseys, jackets, layers, socks—but this one leaves me feeling a bit ambivalent.
review.name: Could be better, but not bad.

name: R Winter Knee Warmers

description: Buy the Selle SMP VT20C-Gel Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: VT20C-Gel Saddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Selle SMP VT20C-Gel Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I rode a hard shell SMP saddle for years and thought it couldn't get any better.  I gave this one a try and wow, it really does get better!  I was skeptical because the gel areas are soft, however I think it's not a problem because the giant cutout prevents pressure.  For gravel riding the bumps are no longer transmitted to the sit bones. On pavement I can sit and pedal for hours and hours, amazed at how comfortable this thing is. Only downside is it's heavy, which made me very hesitant to keep it on my lightweight road bike, but the comfort is well worth it.
review.name: Extremely comfortable

name: VT20C-Gel Saddle

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Trail Sender Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Had to change my review. These will be tempting to wear rock climbing bec they are so comfortable…..whatever you do, don’t do it. I climbed 1 route in a corner and absolutely shredded the pockets to the point of being unusable. These are very thin pants that tear extremely easily. I honestly wouldn’t even wear them hiking, the second your leg touches a bush or tree branch they will rip. The products from Mtn hardware are becoming so cheaply made. Had to send in some other pants I wore 3 times bec the crotch seams were coming undone.
review.name: Very flimsy

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn these pants hiking, biking, around town running errands… I want to wear them all the time! Very comfortable, lightweight, length is perfect (a little above my ankle; I’m 5’8” and bought a medium) and I love a cinch waist- nothing to dig in to the tummy. I thought I’d miss typical hip pockets but I actually really like the side-thigh pockets, and they fit my phone well. Highly recommend!
review.name: New favorite pants!

review.reviewBody: i was a little skeptical of these pants after reading the reviews but took a chance and i love them so much! i am 5’7” 160 lbs with a muscular build and have plenty of room in the medium
review.name: get these pants!

review.reviewBody: Maybe just the color (dark quartz) feels a bit darker than the picture but really happy with my purchase. I bought the medium size after reading the review stating they run big and they fit perfect. 140lbs 5ft2 ! Dont know yet if they durable but the feel light and super confy. Same review than the Dynama high rise jogger because I’m equally satisfied.

Absolutely love these pants for hiking and climbing. Great quality, perfect weight, and XS fits perfectly. Im 5’2 110lbs and it’s hard to find pants that fit this well. Ended up buying a pair in another color since I liked them so much. Would love to get one in a light gray color!
review.name: Amazing pants

review.reviewBody: Nice quality but the length of the pants is too short (as a 5ft6 person). XS fits perfectly otherwise and I weight 125 pounds if this can help anybody with sizing!
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: So confused by these reviews… I’ve been trying forever to find a pair of pants that fit and these fit like a glove. I’m 5’7 and a cyclist so I have built thighs and the large gives me thigh room without a huge waist. The material is fairly thin but because of that, it’s very breathable. Wore and washed these almost daily on an international trip and wished I’d gotten all the colors!
review.name: So comfy!

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’3 curvy around the hips & got medium. They fit perfect! I bought the red and green ones. Would buy 2 more pairs if they weren’t so over priced! Please do not discontinue or change these pants! Mountain hardwear takes their best clothes and changes them to make them worse so please do not do that with these pants!

No stretch, HORRIFICALLY expensive and I’d guess maybe a yard of the thinnest, cheapest material on earth used to make these. No room in the hip or thighs. Women have hips and women have thighs you morons. Huge huge discrepancy between a large and a medium. Too short. Let all my hiking club girls see these and they’re not buying them. Make a woman’s pant with room and stretch for a decent price. These suck
review.name: No Stretch, RUN SUPER SMALL not for a Woman

review.reviewBody: Love how comfortable and versatile these pants are!
review.name: Everyday Pant

name: Trail Sender Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: The sole of the shoe okay. However, the upper party of the shoe feels hard and cheap. Not the quality that I've become use to with Hoka. I was looking for an all black shoe that I could wear as an alternative to the white shoe that I have. However, this one missed the mark!
review.name: Quality lacking

review.reviewBody: Not at all what I was expecting comfort wise. These are very stiff and though they are light weight it feels bulky because there is no cushion feeling. I was expecting more softness like the Bondi 8 feeling like clouds. Bought because it's waterproof and it looks very stylish. Plenty of room in toe box: I'm a true 8B leaning A-B. Always am a 8.5 B in all Hokas. Also got the Clifton L Suede and those are much more comfortable. These would be great if you don't care about the stiffness and want a hard core built to last work shoe. Wouldn't recommend for everyday casual use. Wore indoors for 1 week trying to break in but it didn't help. So sad because I loved them on, just wasn't soft enough as I have plantar fasciitis. Will be exchanging for Bondi 8 because I know I will like them.
review.name: Not For Me

review.reviewBody: I wasn't happy with the look or feel of the style of shoe. I had wanted a "solid" upper & not the "mesh" to be able to wear for winter but this shoe was not the one for me.
review.name: Not what I wanted

review.reviewBody: I have found the perfect sneakers. I have been wearing HOKA Bondi for about 4 years now. My only problem was when they got dirty they were hard to clean. Then I found Bondi SR and now I have the best of both worlds. Stranger stop me and ask me what kind of sneakers I'm wearing. SR has the comfort of HOKA with the flexibility of wiping them clean and keep going. Thank you HOKA
review.name: Just what I Needed!

review.reviewBody: I was expecting my shoes to feel super cushioned but they were hard. They made my feet hurt more.
review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: Work on my feet all day. These shoes are magical! Super cushy, slip resistant soles( perfect for hospital workers). My plantar fasciitis has not bothered me in a year since I started wearing Hoka sneakers. I could barely stand to be on my feet before. They are amazing! Hoka forever!!
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: These professional shoes are great cushion and support for my feet. I am a mail carrier, and my plantar fasciitis is not painful when I'm wearing them. I highly recommend.
review.name: Great for work!

review.reviewBody: Ordered wide but wrong width came. This is my fifth pair. They wear very well, last very long, and they are worth the extra money.
review.name: Shoe was suggested by Ortho doctor they fit well (normally)

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the leather had a total double foot.Reconstruction surgery needed better support than the Hoka soft uppers. The problem is the placement of a ridge inside the bottom of the tongue of the shoe. It rubs terribly on my operated left foot. Can I wear them doing physical therapy...The rocker bottom is a little unsettling for an ankle that needs to be rehabilitated. As I progress I hope it will become more comfortable. Given the price of the shoe I expected more. Especially since they touted it was such a great recovery shoe. As far as the fit send surgery I am size 8 on one foot and a nine on the other foot.
review.name: Good and Bad

review.reviewBody: When I first looked at the sneakers, I thought they too high I might hurt myself. But I wore them and I go on the treadmill and elliptical and so far so good. My second pair of hocus and I'm very happy.
review.name: My review

name: Bondi SR Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this jacket for my 8-year-old daughter.  It was on-sale and I got it for a great price!  I got a similar one for myself (Arcadia II in magenta) and we are both excited to wear them hiking, and to work/school on rainy days.  My daughter loved the pretty, bright pink color, although she said she liked mine better (too bad!  ha ha).  I'd say it runs true-to-size.  I got the size Medium for her which is described as equivalent to a kids' size 10/12.  My daughter is just out of a size 8 and closer to a 10, so the jacket fit slightly big, as expected.  I wanted her to be able to wear it for several years hopefully before outgrowing it.  Overall I'm so happy with my purchase and would definitely purchase it again in the future.  I can't speak to the water resistance, but it seems like a great material and comfy fit for her, although I noticed the sleeves aren't adjustable with velcro like the adults' is, but that's ok.
review.name: Beautiful girls' windbreaker/raincoat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This came in quickly and it's a really great quality. My daughter absolutely loves it.
review.name: Happy with my purchase.

name: Hikebound Jacket - Girls'

hasVariant.description: Buy the Suunto Vertical Watch online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
After getting my Suunto Vertical two days ago, and transitioning from a Garmin 6X Pro, I can say with all honesty the Suunto Vertical is most likely the best sport watch I have had and used.

I knew there would be a learning curve to the new system of the Suunto but what I found was it was easier and much more user intuitive right out of the box versus the Garmin Fēnix 6X Pro (and mind you I LOVED the Garmin Fēnix 6X Pro).

The ease of toggling via the three button/one side placement and the touch screen navigation makes it amazing. I have done only one route and work out (mountain biking) and it was flawless and super accurate.

The design of the Veritcal is GORGEOUS and while it is big, it just feels right and looks great.

Suunto has given the Sport Watch market something to fear with the Vertical.
review.name: Quite Possibly the Best Sport Watch Ever

name: Vertical Watch

review.reviewBody: Love these pants, they are so easy to move in and great for many activities. Would definitely buy again.
review.name: Versatile and comfy

review.reviewBody: Comfortable with a harness, pack, or just hanging around. Slim & stylish and easy care. I loved my first pair so much that I bought another!
review.name: My favourite pants!

review.reviewBody: I've been searching for a replacement hiking pant since my Patagonia Chambeau pants are looking rough around the edges. These pants are comfortable and flattering. I haven't taken them on the trail yet to see how tough they are, but the material has the perfect weight for a 3-season pant. I love that the knees and crotch are gusseted for full range of motion. I only wish the thigh pocket was a bit bigger. I can barely zip my Galaxy S22+ into it. As another review mentioned, there is no integrated belt as the specs (and tag) indicate. I'm 5'5", about 155lb, curvy and a large fit great. I love the curry color and might be back to pick these up in black.
review.name: New go to pants

review.reviewBody: So appreciate the small size offering...So hard to find. I knew that the pant would be comfortable but it looks stylish enough to wear off trail. I am looking forward to traveling with this pant on a hiking vaca in Europe. Fits TTS, though at 5"4" I had to hem (108# size XXS). Note, a belt is describe in the specs, though there is not an integrated belt in the pant. The waistband is non-adjustable, but comfortable at about 4" wide.
review.name: Great hiking pant, and available in a small size!!

name: Alpine Light Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect pant for warm days when you don't want to wear shorts! Super lightweight and breezy, and so comfy. The Khaki is a little sheer, but not problematic. I'm excited to wear them through summer with a tank or tee. Got a small and they fit just right - even on my short self. (Note: I am a Carve employee and was given this product at discount)
review.name: Easy Summer Pant

review.reviewBody: No stretch in this item. The style is loose and flowing in the legs but the waist runs a bit small.
review.name: Light and flowy. Size up due to no stretch in the waist.

review.reviewBody: Unlike other reviewers, I was very disappointed in these pants! I ordered 2 sizes because I was in between. Neither pair had the raw edge hem as pictured or stated in the description. That was the first problem. Second, the color was not as shown. The stripes in the "khaki stripe" we quite prominent in real life and did not show up at all in the photos. These pants were the weight of a casual beach pant but the styling of a more tailored linen pant and they just did not work for me. Too bad--I was was hoping they'd be perfect for my vacation but both pairs went back.
review.name: Did I get the same pants??

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The tailored front with pockets is so smart looking - and they feel so breezy - love the weight and slight stripe of the fabric
review.name: Breezy and stylish

name: Suki Linen Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Good jacket, great rain pants. My son had them out on a rainy afternoon hike in the woods. Had some good steady rain and we were out for a couple hours. He remained dry throughout his adventures. Jacket hood is well designed, stayed in place and moved well with him so he maintained a good field of view. He did have a complaint that there were no pockets to place his collection of twigs, autumnal leaves, and snail shells. So, 4 out of 5 stars for the jacket pockets would be great. 5 out of 5 for the pants.
review.name: Vesi Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: We don't get much rain so the jacket lives in my child's backpack. Our climate is quite hot so most rain jackets eventually delaminate. But this one is constructed differently so I am hopeful that if rain comes the rain jacket will work when needed.
review.name: Great rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: The rain jacket and rain hat I bought were both very practical and were made very well! Spent more than I usually do, but the jacket has lots of room for growth. The hats seem a little small, so size up for room to grow.
review.name: Awesome quality

review.reviewBody: Our toddler loves this jacket! The bear pattern is so cute. Fit is great and material seems comfy. Highly recommend!
review.name: Love!

Great set! We bought 3 sets and they were great for hiking and fishing. Great for layering and kept the kids dry when we encountered some rain. 
Will purchase as the kids grow

review.reviewBody: First of all, I sized up based on previous reviews and had to exchange it for my size on the actual size chart. True to size! However, once I got the correct size, I just felt they were overall too bulky. They stick out awkwardly, especially under a shirt—what few shirts would even fit over. I've had better so I'll go back to what I know.
review.name: Bulky

review.reviewBody: This elbow pad has a lot of protection and is lite weight.  I would probably buy a size-up from what the measurements state for sizing.  This elbow pad has quite a bit of elastic built in it already, so elbow pad won't slip off at all.  However, it was pretty snug getting on my elbow, I ordered a Medium; I was 11.8 inches above elbow & 8 inches below the elbow (which is close to end of M-sizing).  A large would have worked better, especially for when I get sweaty - to get it off / on.  I clicked 'Runs small' on the product fit, it's true to size, however I think it would be best to size up.  My biceps are weak, can't imagine someone with muscles lol... def size up~.  (I'm going to exchange mine, but hopefully this review helps someone so they don't have to buy / exchange)
review.name: Good Elbow pad for protection; size up

review.reviewBody: Both elbow and knee pads fit comfortably on long rides. Not too hot at 85 degrees on the trail. Less pinching up or down than cheaper pads I have owned. Adjustment bands were not digging in through the pad at all.
review.name: Excellent fit at a great price point

name: E-Pact Elbow Pad

review.reviewBody: The zipper looks and feels flimsy and is a little difficult to connect at the bottom. The sleeve length seems a little too long (I ordered Medium size) compared to other brands/manufacturers. Thickness and fleece are reasonable for everyday casual use. The design/cut is a bit odd around the shoulders/arms - it has a seam closer to your elbows instead of at the shoulders. Overall I decided to keep it because I got it at a sale price.
review.name: Fleece jacket for casual use

review.reviewBody:
Not happy. I got TNF Black Heather, Medium. Picture with model in black shows fitting is somewhat slim but it actually runs big. Just weird depiction of the size and honestly quite misleading. I initially ordered black, then placed a second order in gravel heather and blue, thinking they would be a good fit. Now I the only return option is to ship back which will charge me $7 for each return.
Too bad for me.
review.name: Front Range Fleece Jacket - Medium

review.reviewBody: Arrived with a stain
review.name: Ink Stain

name: Front Range Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are wonderful tights. Fit perfectly for my workouts at the gym.
review.name: Great Tights!

review.reviewBody: I bought these leggings to workout at the gym. They fit perfectly and are very comfortable. I will likely buy more.
review.name: very comfortable leggings.

review.reviewBody: Overall, these are nearly perfect. The fit is right, very soft and slick fabric with no spots that pinch or twist. I purchased the black sand color, and they are a dark asphalt grey color. The only downside is this color definitely shows water spots. I bought these for yoga and cycling (cautionary note: the slick fabric is realized on the saddle!). I also find they are great for casual wear.
review.name: Nearly Perfect

review.reviewBody: Love the color, material is so soft and they fit perfectly.
review.name: Soft

review.reviewBody: I am in love with your the leggings. I wear leggings everyday. Texas is hot this time of year, and I find that these are lightweight and breathe. Color black sand is like a charcoal grey, I have purchased two pair. Have you ever considered producing a dark navy? I will keep my eyes peeled.
review.name: Love the leggings

review.reviewBody: Ha- anything you wear that ilicits this question is worth at least 4 stars! In all seriousness, these wear well, washed well. Would love a side pocket for phone or dog treats while walking- that would make them a wear every day 5 star legging.
review.name: My husband asked if I’d lost weight…

review.reviewBody: These leggings are very comfortable with a soft silky feel on your skin. I am 5'6 and 145 pounds and ordered a medium. The leggings fit perfectly. They are grayish black, not true black. A very nice color. I love the leg edge which is not hemmed and very good looking.
review.name: Soft luxurious leggings

review.reviewBody: The wide high waist rolls and slides down in the worst way. These definitely are not all day tights. I could not wait to get these off right after I wore them to a class. The material was nice but I am going to get some three inch elastic and put it through the waist band to even wear in comfort. Do Not Buy. There are much better buys.
review.name: Do Not Buy!

review.reviewBody: Per my wife, super amazing fit. Smooth contours. Don’t move around or ride up. She looks amazing in them. Wow. They’re her favorite leggings!!!
review.name: Amazing!!!!!

review.reviewBody: The material was so comfy, but the cut is skin tight. I trued two different sizes, but the cut trhough the crotch area was too uncomfortable. Returns and exchanges were a breeze though.
review.name: Comfy material. Poor cut for me

name: All Day Legging - Women's

review.reviewBody: Utterly useless.  The strap attachment is very insecure and easily detaches.  I almost lost my phone and passport on a plane when it slipped off as we disembarked.  I pitched it.
review.name: Will never use again

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had this in gray for a couple of years. It is just starting to feel ragged…. However I have used it daily and thrown it in my washing machine (air dried) many times. Despite it being spot clean only. 
I keep phone, wallet, lip balm, and other items in it comfortably that way I can switch it easily between my diaper bag, and my purse when I don’t have my kids. This way…. Keys and wallets don’t go missing! 
Perfect for running in stores with babies or toddlers. A hands free miracle….. it even fits snacks….

I will be making another purchase soon!
review.name: Small size, big storage

review.reviewBody: I almost didn’t buy this bag after seeing several reviewers mentioning the strap unhooks easily. I’ve had this bag for 8 months now and the strap has not come undone on its own. I feel it’s important to leave a review to share my personal experience with it in case there are potential buyers out there hesitant to give this bag a try because they’re afraid the strap will pop off frequently. I’ve enjoyed using this bag daily but I’ll say it gets uncomfortable if you hang the bag on your neck when you have heavier items in it - the strap isn’t the most comfortable against the skin. Otherwise, it’s a good casual bag to have!
review.name: Decent Bag

review.reviewBody: while this is a great material and functional as a pocket it is unfortubately not safe to wear outside due to the attachments not being fit for purpose. The attachments make this bag unusable outside because it can easily become detached and fall off your neck. It's happended to me twice and sence then I only wear this in the offie at work to carry my phone around but would never again wear it outside for fear of losing it and my belongings with it. I'm actually sorry I kept it and did not trust my instincts the moment I saw the attachment points. It's a very dissapointing product. .
review.name: not recommended

review.reviewBody: Love the size, functionality, strap length.  Don’t love the strap atttachment hooks which easily pop off. It would be a big design improvement if the hooks were replaced with a more secure latch. Then you would definitely have my 5 stars.
review.name: Hooks need improvement

review.reviewBody: Had this bag for over a year and it's held up good but I'm due for a new crossbody bag. I used this bag everywhere from hiking and camping to concerts, errands, and work. It's very functional and convenient for everyday and hiking because it fits your essentials like phone, wallet, keys, lip balm, and eye drops and your items are so easily accessible. The outer fabric has worn out after a year and there's some small holes poked from my keys and the logo stitching has come off. But I would repurchase again since it worked so well
review.name: Great for everything

review.reviewBody:
The small size packs a lot, and perfect if you want to avoid carrying a bulky purse. 
-easy access to keys (I used the extra loops to attach a lanyard)
-large iPhone
-wallet
-car keys
-earbuds 
-chapstick, etc.
The strap style that attaches to opposite corners is the best arrangement. Hanging in the front is easy access, or rotate to your back and it will be more snug and you could bend down or run if you had to. Extremely durable fabric.
review.name: I have used this everyday for the past 3 years

review.reviewBody: I used this bag for a trip to France. It was very easy to carry and held most of what I needed. I just wish it was about an inch longer and wider. I wasn’t able to carry a small umbrella or water bottle. It is very durable and cute
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Perfect size, perfect design! Love it! Ideal for whatever im doing hiking, shopping, events...
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I personally love this bag so much, perfect size for a large iPhone, credit/ID cards. Minus 1 star because the front pouch zipper kept getting stuck on the “key ring” insert. I ended up cutting it off so this problem stops happening.
review.name: Amazing bag

name: High Coast Pocket
