review.reviewBody: Bought this product two years ago and wore for 2 weeks and had the same minor tearing that continually tore worse and worse. The footbed was super comfortable, but the mesh is awful. I got them replaced thinking there was just something wrong with the pair I got, switched sizes in case that was the problem and same thing happened. When I tried to contact Salomon again I was told, "we don't warranty an already warrantied pair" and was stuck with a poor product. This was after multiple phone calls to remedy the problem.
review.name: do not buy
comment: Hi, thank you for sharing your ecperience with us. We’re sorry we couldn’t find the right solution for you this time. Your case has been passed to the relevant department and will be taken into consideration for improvements in our processes.

review.reviewBody: I should have read the reviews.  I have had several pairs of salomon trail shoes that were incredibly durable... These are  starting to crack at the medial / big toe junction after minor usage, as others have commented on.  They are comfortable and stable like my other Salomon shoes, but the upper material is not very durable.
review.name: comfortable but not durable
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Purchased these shoes 2 months ago brand new. Wore about 3 days a week, and 2 holes wore into each shoe at the toes around 2 months in. I did not do anything aggressive in these shoes, just casual walking, hiking in the desert. Very dissapointed with how these held up. I have since switched to the Altra lone peak 6’s and love them
review.name: Lasted 2 months
comment:
Thank you for your feedback. Here, at Salomon, we always appreciate hearing what customers have to say about our products!
We´re sorry to hear about the issue with the product. Please, expect to be contacted shortly by our team, we would like to help in any way we can!

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable shoe! Bought 2 pair in March of 2022-unfortunately the mesh just doesn’t hold up-
review.name: Mesh doesn’t hold up
comment:
Hello! Thanks for your comment! 

If you are experiencing some problems with your shoes please do not hesitate to contact our customer service team, they will be more than happy to check your shoes. 

https://www.salomon.com/en-us/shop/contact

review.reviewBody: The Ultra Raid is an excellent all rounder. Narrower at the front than the Ultra Pro with a sleek fit, perfect if you have a narrower foot. Standard lacing and a simple thin tongue that doesn’t hold water. The lugs are surprisingly grippy for such small lugs. I would like to see the rear counter with a slightly more durable outsole, especially if you run long or slow in this shoe when heel strike is greater but that’s certainly not a deal breaker. Sizing wise you can go 1 full size smaller than the Speedcross in my view. I am a 9.5UK in this shoe and would go 10.5 in Speedcross. It fits more like the range of road shoes where I have always been 9.5.
review.name: Excellent Shoe. Responsive and light.

review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable right out of the box. I could comfortably wear all day. Light, breathes well and supportive.

But... the mesh seems fragile. after just a dozen wears, very clear holes appear where the shoe bends and the foot leaves the ground. Not even from trail running or bush walking, just normal wear. Pretty disappointed.
review.name: Great but...

review.reviewBody: After a few weeks this shoe fell apart. Do NOT purchase this product.
review.name: Terrible
comment: We are sorry about your experience with this footwear. We will send you further information about our Warranty pollicy, since all Salomon footwear has 2-years warranty. Apologies for any inconvenience.

review.reviewBody: Die hard Salomon fan and these are the most comfortable shoes that I have ever owned. Unfortunately, they fell apart in two weeks of walking from the train to work on sidewalks. They have the durability of a potato chip!
review.name: Fell apart in a week!

review.reviewBody: Love this shoe, but like others have mentione, there is a major design flaw that rapidly degrades the upper where the toe box flexes.  I would not recommend buying this shoe due to the wear after just light/casual use.
review.name: Great looking shoe with a MAJOR design flaw
comment:
Hello there, 

 

Thank you for your feedback. We here at Salomon always appreciate hearing what customers have to say about our products! 

We´re sorry to hear about the issue with the product. Please contact us directly at the link bellow to provide more details and discuss the issue. We are more than happy to help. 

https://www.salomon.com/en-us/contact/form 

If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact our Customer Service Department on Tel : +18332300292 (7-17 MDT, Mon - Fri)

review.reviewBody: The mesh is weakest link. It has started to rip and tear at creases in toe box. Also, tounge design isn’t very comfortable at all. Style and comments are great. Lots of compliments. Too bad these won’t last.
review.name: Love these but….
comment:
We are sorry to hear about the problems you had with the material on your on your shoes.

As your shoes come with a warranty of up to 2 years I have opened up a warranty claim for you, so we can take a closer look at this matter in detail and see if we can resolve this issue for you. If you would like to continue with this can you please respond to the email I sent to you and we can proceed from there?

Additionally your feedback has been passed internally for review and consideration.

name: Ultra Raid Shoe

review.reviewBody: I purchased the stem for primarily two reasons.  One, the vibration dampening properties of carbon over aluminum and aesthetics. The stem weighs basically the same as the one it replaced; however, it does feel much stiffer and my ride seems smoother.  One thing I know for certain is that it is good looking and it is obvious that care was taken making this product.  It looks absolutely great on my bike!  It has a "beefier" look than the outgoing stem which I personally like.  Yes the price is up there but if you like good looking well made "stuff" you will like this stem and it is worth the money!
review.name: Super Nice!

review.reviewBody: Well made and sexy
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit for my growing 12 year old! We had a hard time trying to find a pack for my son that would fit his waist and his torso properly.  He is very thin for his age, but this pack fit the bill.  For reference He is 59" tall and weighs 69lbs. We have it set to the smallest size right now, but it will grow with him.  He used it last weekend for a Scout campout.  It fit all of his gear for the weekend with plenty of additional room.
review.name: Perfect for growing tweens/teens!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a merino undies zealot and have tried several brands now - hands down, IB is my favorite. Perfect fit: not too high, wide enough under bits, stays in place, no camel toe, sufficiently durable.
